N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 373-2.4 - Consideration of income and resources

State Regulations
(a) In determining the income and resources
of applicants for and recipients of RMA, the following may not be considered by
a social services district: (1)
any resources
remaining in the applicant's country of origin; (2)
in-kind services and shelter provided to
an applicant by a sponsor or resettlement agency; (3)
a sponsor's income and resources; and
(4)
any cash grant received by
the applicant under the United States Department of State or Department of

Justice reception and placement programs. (b) The social services district must base
eligibility for RMA on the applicant's income and resources on the date of
application. It may not use the practice of averaging income prospectively over
the application processing period in determining income eligibility for
RMA. Notes
